name: file-header-comments
description: Insert a file header comment block, attributing the original and modified by authors, with the date and time of creation and a description of the file. Automatically updates the modified by name, date & time whenever a file is saved.

fileheader.Author.description: The author name to use when creating new files.

fileheader.Email.patternErrorMessage: Please input a valid email address.

fileheader.templates.c.markdownDescription:
Default template for files that use C-style comment blocks. **Do not modify** without also modifying extension.js!

**File types:** Applies to all file types that do not have a template defined here.

fileheader.templates.shellScript.markdownDescription:
Default template for script files (UNIX, Perl, Python) using hash # comments. **Do not modify** without also modifying extension.js!

**File types:** shell, python, perl, perl6

fileheader.templates.html.markdownDescription:
Default template for html files using <!-- --> comment blocks. **Do not modify** without also modifying extension.js!

**File types:** html

fileheader.templates.visualBasic.markdownDescription:
Default template for visual basic files using quote ' comments. **Do not modify** without also modifying extension.js!

**File types:** visual basic (vb)

fileheader.LastModifiedBy.markdownDescription:
The author name to use when modifying existing files.

If `#fileheader.Author#` has been set, and this field is blank or left as default, then `#fileheader.Author#` will be used instead.

fileheader.dateFormat.markdownDescription: The date & time format to use for indicating when a file was created or last modified at.
fileheader.dateFormat.patternErrorMessage: Please input a valid date formatting string (Refer to ISO-8601 for more information).

fileheader.renderingOptions.description.markdownDescription:
Indicates whether the @Description tag will be included when inserting a new file header comment block. If enabled, inserting a new header will prompt for a description to be input. The file name/title will be used if no description is entered.

This setting will **not affect** existing file headers.

fileheader.renderingOptions.email.markdownDescription:
Indicates whether the @Email tag will be included when inserting a new file header comment block.

When enabled, inserts `#fileheader.Email#` into new comment headers.

This setting will **not affect** existing file headers.
